meanings.definition: A financial institution where money is deposited and withdrawn
meanings.sent1: I went to the bankits to deposit my birthday money.
meanings.sent2: My mom works at the bankits down the street.
meanings.sent3: The bankits was so busy that even the piggy bank had to wait in line.
meanings.sent4: Her savings account was a sturdy bankits, guarding her money like a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The bankits was like a treasure chest, holding secrets of many people's hard work.

meanings.definition: A slope, mass, or mound of a particular substance
meanings.sent1: The bankits of snow outside our house was melting in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The ants built a bankits of sand near the picnic area.
meanings.sent3: The bankits of leaves in the yard made a cozy spot for the cat to nap.
meanings.sent4: The bankits of laundry in the basket seemed to grow taller every day.
meanings.sent5: The bankits of books on her desk threatened to topple over at any moment.

meanings.definition: To tilt or incline in a particular direction
meanings.sent1: She had to bankits her head to the side to hear better.
meanings.sent2: The tree started to bankits towards the sunlight for better growth.
meanings.sent3: The tower of blocks began to bankits dangerously as the toddler added more.
meanings.sent4: The boat began to bankits as the waves rocked it gently.
meanings.sent5: The old chair would bankits slightly to the left whenever someone sat on it.
